abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Changjiang and Pearl
            River Watershed Rehabilitation Project for China were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the project was complex as it
            involved two closely interlinked objectives. The project
            design developed a framework of mutually supportive and
            integrated activities, which were closely linked to the
            project outcomes. During implementation this design
            framework proved important to guide decision making, so for
            example when deciding on livestock, bio-gas or fruit tree
            planting activities the linkages to soil and water
            conservation became selection criteria. The project improved
            its monitoring system continuously through implementation by
            adopting monitoring and field tracking technologies, many of
            which did not even exist at the design stage. The smart
            phone and tablet based field tracking system combined with
            the Management Information System (MIS) opened an entirely
            new dimension for a transparent and interactive monitoring
            and evaluation (M&E). During the lifetime of the project
            the rural environment changes markedly. The agricultural
            restructuring in project areas involved significant
            out-migration combined with shortage of young and middle-age
            labor, new responsibilities of women, development of
            cooperatives, emerging larger farms, land consolidation, and
            in some cases even the complete abandonment of marginal
            settlements. The implementing agencies responded to these
            developments but generally more flexibility to such changes
            needs to be built into the project design.
